law.catch_line: INTERFERENCE WITH FIREFIGHTER; GETTING ON OR OFF APPARATUS; LOITERING; MEDDLING WITH APPARATUS.

section.text: It shall be unlawful for any person to interfere with a firefighter in the discharge of his duty, or to get on or off of the apparatus going to or from a fire without authority from the Chief or Assistant Chief, or to loiter about the engine houses, or for any person to meddle with the engine, hose, or apparatus. (Code 1959 , §10-10)
